channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This wedding photographer now removes landmines for a group that's won a top prize
item.description: The Mines Advisory Group has been removing landmines for more than three decades. This year, it received the Conrad N. Hilton Humanitarian Prize, a pr...

item.title: Kids who use social media score lower on reading and memory tests, a study shows
item.description: Data from a large, ongoing study of adolescents shows a link between increasing social media use and lower cognition and memory in teens.

item.title: Highlighting Indigenous stories from across NPR's network
item.description: NPR is highlighting Indigenous stories from across its network in celebrations of Indigenous Peoples Day.

item.title: Media companies thought late night TV was irrelevant. Kimmel proved them wrong
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel's return to airwaves might just point the way forward for late night TV to prove its relevance to American audiences — and to itself.

item.title: Natural gas prices are low, but your monthly gas bill is up. Here's why
item.description: Gas utility bills are rising even though natural gas prices are down. That's because a much larger share of your gas bill now goes to infrastructure i...

item.title: 2 dead in fiery small plane crash on Route 195 in Dartmouth
item.description: A small plane crashed on Route 195 in Dartmouth, Massachusetts Monday. Two people on board were killed.

item.title: 'Long and painful nightmare finally over,' Trump tells Israel's parliament
item.description: The US president was applauded by Israeli lawmakers for his role in brokering an Israel-Hamas ceasefire.

item.title: Palestinians celebrate return of prisoners freed by Israel
item.description: Thousands of people gather in Gaza and the West Bank to welcome Palestinian prisoners and detainees freed by Israel.

item.title: Face the Nation: Frost, Salvanto
item.description: Missed the second half of the show? The latest on...Rep. Maxwell Frost of Florida has signed a letter urging Congress to return from recess to repleni...

item.title: Rescuers search for missing in Mexico's flooded towns
item.description: At least 64 people are dead and scores are missing after tropical storms triggered torrential rains.

item.title: India and Canada reset ties after strain of Sikh leader's murder
item.description: Canada's foreign minister visits Delhi as the sides restore ties strained by a murder on Canadian soil.

item.title: 16 killed in Tennessee plant explosion remembered by community
item.description: The cause of the deadly blast remained under investigation. Crews were carefully going through incinerated property, searching for possible evidence.

item.title: Supreme Court takes up Republican attack on Voting Rights Act in case over Black representation
Arthur M. Blank Family Foundation donating $50 million to historically Black Atlanta colleges
Trump urges Israel and Palestinians to embrace peace as living hostages freed
item.description: President Trump got a standing ovation after addressing Israeli lawmakers following Hamas' release of all living hostages under the Gaza peace deal.

item.title: Government shutdown live updates as stalemate poised to begin third week
item.description: The government shutdown stretched into Day 13 on Monday with no sign of an imminent resolution. Follow live updates here.

item.title: Dozens rescued as remnants of typhoon hits Alaska while nor’easter brings flooding to East Coast
item.description: Authorities say more than 30 people were rescued and three people remain unaccounted for in western Alaska after the remnants of Typhoon Halong brough...

item.title: Cameroon awaits presidential election result
item.description: Paul Biya, who at 92 is the world's oldest head of state, is being challenged by nine candidates.
